revised_title: Particle-laden Jet Velocity and Flux Characteristics in Turbulent Flows
tldr: This study investigates the velocity and flux characteristics of spherical glass beads in a turbulent particle-laden jet. Using phase-Doppler anemometry, the researchers measured the velocity and flux distributions in the jet as a function of particle volume fraction and size. The results provide insight into particle mixing and help facilitate the understanding of particle dispersion in turbulent flows.
